title.narrative: 7.1 GENERATE STRATEGIC INFORMATION

description.narrative: 7.1 Strengthened institutional capacity for decentralized gender-sensitive planning, implementation, monitoring and evaluation of programmes, with emphasis on convergence of recovery and development programmes and community participation by 2019., which contributes to Child Poverty / Public Finance For Children, Cross-Sectoral Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses, Cross-Sectoral Planning And Programme Reviews, Human Rights Institutions, Other Cross-Sectoral Programme Areas, Policy Advocacy â€“ Urban, Civil Society, Parliament, Environment, Public Finance And Local Governance, Social Exclusion â€“ Data And Evidence, Social Protection, Social Protection And Child Poverty. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: 7.0 Improved policy environment and systems for disadvantaged and excluded children, guided by improved knowledge and data by 2019.

sector.narrative: Child poverty analysis towards policy change (Profiling, mapping and identifying drivers of multi-dimensional and monetary poverty of children, modelling and simulation of policy options)
Child poverty measurement: support to routine national measurement of monetary and multidimensional child poverty

Contributing to policies reducing child poverty: Poverty reduction strategies, national development plans, engagement with ministries, parliament, international donor and financial organizations, civil society organizations)
Country programme process (including UNDAF planning and CCA)
Situation Analysis or Update on women and children
Stimulating demand for and capacity to use data

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: 7.1 Strengthened institutional capacity for decentralized gender-sensitive planning, implementation, monitoring and evaluation ofprogrammes, with emphasis on convergence of recovery and development programmes and community participation by 2019.

description.narrative: Statistics Sierra Leone (Stats-SL) earns a seat at the UN Statistical Commission as a result of its commitment to child poverty and enhanced capacity to generate data to be used for planning, monitoring and evaluation. The 2018 Multidimensional Child Poverty Report was launched by the Minister of Planning and Economic Development, showing that poverty declined by 11 percentile points from 77 per cent in 2010. Vulnerability and equity profiles, used to influence evidence-based planning down to the community level, were developed for each of the 16 districts by Local Councils using MICS6 data. | Status:Met | As-of Date:05/02/2020
